column9: Initiative from the undisclosed GRI (found by the coder but not mentioned in the GRI index table)

column13: Since 2018, renewable energy contracts have provided 100% of Kao Data's electricity supply. More recently, Kao Data instigated a unique collaboration with its energy provider to ensure all the renewable energy is associated with a known source - the Little Cheyne Court wind farm in Kent. Every electron of utility energy Kao Data consumes is matched by an equivalent output from this wind farm using the Renewable Energy Guarantees of Origin ('REGO') scheme.
column20: Renewable Energy Contracts, Wind Farm Collaboration, Energy Efficiency

column9: Alternative to diesel for backup power
column13: HVO is a second-generation diesel alternative and one of the cleanest biofuels on the market. Synthesised from vegetable oils, HVO offers improved burning efficiency and requires no modification to existing infrastructure. It has a storage life of ten times that of standard diesel and offers resilient year-round performance in low and high temperatures.

column6: Reductions in energy requirements of products and services
column13: The MRI equipment installed last year includes artificial intelligence that can reduce scan times by up to 50% and directly translate into 50% less energy consumption for each examination. Extrapolated out, that adds up to 13% energy savings per annum.

column6: Interactions with water as a shared resource
column13: Water-efficient initiatives to reduce potable water consumption include highly efficient fixtures and fittings, water-efficient appliances and an energy-efficient, air-cooled temperature control system. These design initiatives will mean a 40% reduction in energy use and a 20% reduction in water use compared to the Green Star standard benchmark.
column20: Energy-efficient Equipment, Artificial Intelligence, Water Efficiency

column6: Operational sites owned, leased, managed in, or adjacent to, protected areas and areas of high biodiversity value outside protected areas
column7: Longroad's portfolio spans 12 US states and covers thousands of hectares. At the project evaluation phase, Longroad assesses the area's existing conditions and determines how best to reduce potential impacts on resources and, where feasible, enhance biodiversity. Examples include planting native grasses and pollinating plants to benefit insects and birds.

column6: Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
column13: At one wind farm site, eagles sometimes fly near the wind turbines. To reduce the risk of collision, the company installed the IdentiFlight system, which is only deployed at a handful of sites worldwide. IdentiFlight monitoring consists of 10-foot-tall masts with 360-degree cameras on top.
column20: Wildlife Protection, Collision Risk Mitigation, Ecosystem Services

column6: Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
column13: In Virginia, Longroad developed the Foxhound Solar project - the first large-scale solar project to be certified as "Pollinator-Smart" by the State Department of Conservation and Recreation. The project's use of pollinator plant species helps support native insects, birds and other wildlife populations while improving soil stabilisation and water retention, among many other ecosystem services.
column20: Pollinator-friendly Solar Project, Biodiversity Conservation, Ecosystem Services

column6: Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
column13: In another example of Longroad being a leader in implementing innovative technology, the company deployed the Swarm tool developed by WindESCo. It optimises annual energy production from all the turbines at a wind farm, rather than focusing on individual turbines, by eliminating wake interference and using AI feedback for continuous improvement. The Swarm technology is inspired by nature and the intuitive decision-making of birds in flight.
column20: Wind Farm Optimization, AI Technology, Energy Production

column7: In FY2023, 45% of our portfolio companies measured operational waste. Two entities have set operational waste reduction targets Ã¢ÂÂ we set out details of Wellington Airport's waste target on page 24. Over time, we want to expand the number of companies reporting and setting targets for operational waste and to grow reporting boundaries to include reporting on construction waste (as operational waste does not include construction waste).

column6: Non-compliance with environmental laws and regulations
column13: In 2021, the first stage of The Verge at Burleigh achieved a 4-Star Green Star rating from the GBCA for using passive design principles, including innovative insulation, glazing selection, LED lighting and an entire rooftop of solar panels. The rating distinguishes The Verge as 'best practice' in sustainable design and was the first Green Star certification on a greenfield site for RetireAustralia.

column13: The Infratil Board has undertaken an annual deep dive into human capital across the portfolio for the last few years. This year, Morrison & Co established an "HR Community of Practice" of HR managers across the portfolio to support sharing ideas, experiences, and best practices.

column7: Managing risks, including ESG risks, and integrating ESG considerations throughout the investment lifecycle are critical factors for ensuring our business's and portfolio companies' long-term success and resilience. Key focus areas are ESG risks such as cyber-security and data protection, climate change, business ethics and regulatory environment.
